title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: rPHG objects can created two primary sources: * local data * server connections Creating initial “connection” objects helps unify downstream reading evaluation steps PHGv2 data. next couple sections, show create either local server connnection objects.

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: Local connections local TileDB instances direct locations hVCF files local disk. create local connection, create PHGLocalCon object using following constructor function: example, create connection example local hVCF files provided rPHG2 package: LineA.h.vcf LineB.h.vcf Since full paths files differ user, can use system.file() function get full path: get full path extdata directory file, LineA.h.vcf, found rPHG2 source code. can build create collection full file paths hVCF data: Now collection hVCF files, can use PHGLocalCon() constructor function create PHGLocalCon object: , can move next section create HaplotypeGraph object interface JVM.
code: PHGLocalCon() system.file("extdata", "LineA.h.vcf", package = "rPHG2") hVcfFiles <- system.file(     "extdata",      c("LineA.h.vcf", "LineB.h.vcf"),      package = "rPHG2" ) localCon <- hVcfFiles |> PHGLocalCon()  localCon ## A PHGLocalCon connection object ##  ❯ DB URI....   : ◯ ##  ❯ hVCF Files...: ◉

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: Conversely, server locations databases served publicly available web services leveraging Breeding API (BrAPI) endpoints. Since connection server, URL path instead local file path needed. use PHGServerCon() constructor function create PHGServerCon object: example, made assumptions URL: Uses secure transfer protocol (https) Uses default ports data serving BrAPI specified endpoints points 1 2, URL uses non-secure protocols (“http”) /modified port number, need specify protocol port parameters constructor function. example: point 3, constructor resolve mandatory endpoints, exception occur.
code: srvCon <- "phg.maizegdb.org" |> PHGServerCon()  srvCon ## A PHGServerCon connection object ##  ❯ Host............: phg.maizegdb.org ##  ❯ Server Status...: 200 (OK) "www.my-unsecure-phg.org" |>      PHGServerCon(         port     = 5300,          protocol = "http"     )

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: Now either local server-based connection object, can convert raw hVCF data HaplotypeGraph JVM object bridge Java reference pointer R using function, buildHaplotypeGraph(): example, took local connection object passed HaplotypeGraph constructor. , basic class contains pointer object can direct data Java R:
code: graph <- localCon |> buildHaplotypeGraph()  graph ## A HaplotypeGraph object @ 17f9d882 ##  ❯ # of ref ranges....: 38 ##  ❯ # of taxa..........: 2 ##  ❯ # of chromosomes...: 2 graph |> javaRefObj() ## [1] "Java-Object{net.maizegenetics.phgv2.api.HaplotypeGraph@17f9d882}"

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: Now created HaplotypeGraph object, can begin reading data using read* family rPHG2 functions.

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: return vector sample IDs graph object, can use readSamples() function:
code: graph |> readSamples() ## [1] "LineA" "LineB"

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: return information reference ranges found within graph object, can use readRefRanges() function. return GRanges object common data class GenomicRanges package:

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: return haplotype IDs “sample \(\times\) reference range” matrix object, can use readHapIds() function:

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: return metadata haplotype ID tibble object, can use readHapIdMetaData() function:
code: graph |> readHapIdMetaData() ## # A tibble: 76 × 6 ##    hap_id                 sample_name description source checksum ref_range_hash ##    <chr>                  <chr>       <chr>       <chr>  <chr>    <chr>          ##  1 0eb9029f3896313aebc69… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      39f96726321b3… ##  2 12f0cec9102e84a161866… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      546d1839623a5… ##  3 13417ecbb38b9a159e3ca… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      5812acb1aff74… ##  4 18498579d89483ac270e8… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      e07d04d2fc96b… ##  5 184a72815a2ba5949635c… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      cb86faf105b19… ##  6 1b568197f6f329ec5b71f… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      d896e9cc56e74… ##  7 1e38bd82670c3f10982f7… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      db22dfc14799b… ##  8 3149b3144f93134eb2966… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      57705b1e2541c… ##  9 369464a8743d2e40ad83d… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      66465399052d8… ## 10 3ec680649615da0685b8c… LineA       haplotype … /User… Md5      347f0478b1a55… ## # ℹ 66 more rows

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: return positional information haplotype ID another tibble object, can use readHapIdPosMetaData() function:

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: majority cases, may need one piece hVCF data. can read prior data simultaneously PHGDataSet object -R-memory representation hVCF data: object created, can use prior read* methods instantaneously pull previously mentioned R data objects: readSamples() readRefRanges() readHapIds() readHapIdMetaData() readHapIdPosMetaData()
code: graph |> readPhgDataSet() ## A PHGDataSet object ##  ❯ # of ref ranges....: 38 ##  ❯ # of samples.......: 2 ## --- ##  ❯ # of hap IDs.......: 76 ##  ❯ # of asm regions...: 76

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: cases, may want query information focus one specific reference range /sample(s). can filter PHGDataSet objects using filter* family functions. following examples, let’s picture primary data 2-dimensional matrix : samples (rows) reference ranges (columns) hap ID data (elements) represent object R called phgDs, look like following diagram:
code: phgDs

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: want filter based sample ID, can use filterSamples() function. Simply add sample ID collection sample IDs character string vector character strings, respectively. Using prior diagram reference, filter anything following: B73 Ky21 Mo17  Note: samples added filter collection, present data, discarded. samples found, exception thrown stating samples found.
code: phgDs |> filterSamples(c("B73", "Ky21", "Mo17"))

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: want filter based sample ID, can use filterRefRanges() function. Currently, takes GRanges object can specify integer-based ranges located genomic regions chromosome (.e., seqnames). example, want return ranges intersect following genomic regions: can create following GRanges object pass filter method:
code: gr <- GRanges(     seqnames = c("1", "2"),     ranges = IRanges(         c(100, 800),         c(400, 900)     ) )   phgDs |> filterRefRanges(gr)

title: Introduction to rPHG2
text: Since two dimensions, can filter simultaneously “piping” combining filter methods one pass:
code: gr <- GRanges(     seqnames = c("1", "2"),     ranges = IRanges(         c(100, 800),         c(400, 900)     ) )  phgDs |>      filterSamples(c("B73", "Ky21", "Mo17")) |>      filterRefRanges(gr)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brandon Monier. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Monier B (2024). rPHG2: R interface PHGv2. R package version 0.3.1,  https://rphg2.maizegenetics.net/, https://github.com/maize-genetics/rPHG2.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rPHG2: R interface to PHGv2},   author = {Brandon Monier},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.1,  https://rphg2.maizegenetics.net/},   url = {https://github.com/maize-genetics/rPHG2}, }

title: R interface to PHGv2
text: rPHG2 system interact retrieve information version 2 Practical Haplotype Graph (PHGv2) - general, graph-based, computational framework genotype inference. accomplished leveraging Breeding PHG APIs.

title: R interface to PHGv2
text: can install development version rphg2 GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("maize-genetics/rPHG2")

title: R interface to PHGv2
code: initPhg("my/phg/jar/path")

title: R interface to PHGv2
code: locCon <- list.files("my/hvcf/dir") |>     PHGLocalCon()

title: R interface to PHGv2
code: graph <- locCon |> buildHaplotypeGraph()

title: R interface to PHGv2
code: phgDs <- graph |> readPhgDataSet()

title: R interface to PHGv2
code: gr <- GRanges(     seqnames = c("1", "2"),     ranges = IRanges(         c(100, 800),         c(400, 900)     ) )  phgDs |>      filterSamples(c("B73", "Ky21", "Mo17")) |>      filterRefRanges(gr)

title: R interface to PHGv2
text: rPHG2 relatively new R package may subject changes workflow function definitions. like see anything added run problems, please feel free contact team using issues page.

title: R interface to PHGv2
text: installed locally, can read “Introduction rPHG2” vignette using: Alternatively, package’s website another great place read function usage, code changes, workflows.
code: vignette("rPHG2")

title: A PHGDataSet Class — PHGDataSet-class
text: PHGDatSet class general class storing data found within hVCF file. main components : samples Sample IDs reference ranges start/stop ranges reference genome haplotypes haplotype sequence IDs (MD5 hashes) metadata additional information related haplotype IDs Prints information regarding properties PHGDataSet class console

title: A PHGDataSet Class — PHGDataSet-class
text: samples character vector sample identifiers. refRanges GRanges object GenomicRanges package representing reference genomic ranges. hapIds matrix haplotype identifiers. hapIdMeta tibble object containing metadata associated haplotype identifiers. hapIdMetaPos tibble object containing positional metadata haplotype identifiers.

title: PHGServerCon object constructor — PHGServerCon
text: host user defined URL port host port. NULL, default port (e.g. 80 443) used depending protocol. protocol protocol must used fetch desired data? Must either http https. Defaults http. version BrAPI version number. Must either "v1" "v2". Defaults v2.

title: rPHG2 0.3
text: memory representation hVCF data sets Filters relevant rPHG2 data objects reference range Requires GRanges object input Filters relevant rPHG2 data objects sample ID Input basic character vector sample identifiers

title: rPHG2 0.2
text: Added JVM connections via rJava interface Wrapper PHGv2 API Java graph object Interface local hVCF database file connections Initializes JVM adds PHGv2 Java JARs classpath Reads haplotype IDs character matrix connection object Reads ALT header metadata haplotype ID connection object Reads ALT header positional metadata haplotype ID connection object Reads sample IDs connection object Read reference range positional information GRanges object connection object
